alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe; Halifax; Nash (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 8:07PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Nash, northern Edgecombe and Halifax Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 807 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Gasburg to near Littleton to near Dortches to 7 miles west of Nashville. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rocky Mount, Roanoke Rapids, Halifax, Scotland Neck, Dortches, Littleton, Red Oak, Enfield, Weldon and Whitakers. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
